fields.value: The Consequences of Religious Strictness for Political Participation

dsDescriptionValue.value: Subset of data from the 2006 Portraits of American Life Study. Corresponding R code estimates measurement models for religious strictness, church participation, and civic participation. Also estimates a recursive model of political participation, using multiple imputation to handle missing data.

publicationCitation.value: Dahan, Charles and James E. Monogan III. "The Consequences of Religious Strictness for Political Participation." Social Science Journal.

files.description: R program that performs multiple random imputation on the data and then replicates the analysis of Tables 1 and 2 from the article. The program also includes three robustness checks in which alternate measures of the treatment variable are used. The robustness checks are reported in the online appendix.
files.label: analysisStrictPartic.R

dataFile.description: R program that performs multiple random imputation on the data and then replicates the analysis of Tables 1 and 2 from the article. The program also includes three robustness checks in which alternate measures of the treatment variable are used. The robustness checks are reported in the online appendix.

files.description: Online appendix reporting a variety of alternate analyses that served as robustness checks for the original results reported in the article.
files.label: palsAdditional.pdf

dataFile.description: Online appendix reporting a variety of alternate analyses that served as robustness checks for the original results reported in the article.

files.description: R program for cleaning the original Portraits of American Life survey data in preparation for analysis. This program is available for researchers wishing to download the original survey dataset (only available at http://www.thearda.com/pals/) and retrace our steps of measurement.
files.label: palsCleaning.R

dataFile.description: R program for cleaning the original Portraits of American Life survey data in preparation for analysis. This program is available for researchers wishing to download the original survey dataset (only available at http://www.thearda.com/pals/) and retrace our steps of measurement.

files.description: Description of the data and each of the variables in the file palsStrictPartic.dta.
files.label: palsCodebook.txt

dataFile.description: Description of the data and each of the variables in the file palsStrictPartic.dta.

files.description: 1196 observations from the Portraits of American Life survey of 2006. These serve as the replication data from Tables 1 and 2 in the paper. Please visit http://www.thearda.com/pals/ for more information. Usage of these data require including the following citation: Emerson, Michael O., and David Sikkink. Portraits of American Life Study, 1st Wave, 2006.
files.label: palsStrictPartic.tab

dataFile.description: 1196 observations from the Portraits of American Life survey of 2006. These serve as the replication data from Tables 1 and 2 in the paper. Please visit http://www.thearda.com/pals/ for more information. Usage of these data require including the following citation: Emerson, Michael O., and David Sikkink. Portraits of American Life Study, 1st Wave, 2006.

files.description: R program that performs multiple random imputation on the data and then estimates nine logistic regression models for separate indicators of specific acts of participation. The results of these analyses are reported in the online appendix.
files.label: separateLogits.R

dataFile.description: R program that performs multiple random imputation on the data and then estimates nine logistic regression models for separate indicators of specific acts of participation. The results of these analyses are reported in the online appendix.
